summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 between lawyers at Blackfords LLP and U.S. prosecutors regarding a client willing to provide a witness statement about Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. The lawyers propose a written statement and written Q&A, limiting scope to 1994-1997, and seek confidentiality assurances, as they note the U.S. side views their client as a 'subject' rather than a witness.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.context: Lawyer representing an unnamed client, corresponding with U.S. prosecutors to negotiate terms for his client's cooperation via a witness statement regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Daniel Cundy
persons.context: Lawyer at Blackfords LLP corresponding with U.S. prosecutors, sending reference materials regarding legal procedures and protections.

persons.name: Jennifer Richardson
persons.context: Copied on emails between Blackfords LLP and U.S. prosecutors regarding the client's potential cooperation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the U.S. criminal prosecution (U.S. v Ghislaine Maxwell). The document discusses a client's potential witness statement regarding his association with and knowledge of her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and associate of Ghislaine Maxwell. The document discusses a client's potential witness statement regarding his association with and knowledge of him.

connections.description: Gary Bloxsome is a partner at Blackfords LLP representing the unnamed client in negotiations with U.S. prosecutors.
Daniel Cundy is a partner at Blackfords LLP involved in the correspondence regarding the legal protections for the client.
The client has an association with Ghislaine Maxwell and possesses knowledge about her relevant to her prosecution.
The client has an association with Jeffrey Epstein and possesses knowledge about him.
Both are partners at Blackfords LLP working on the same matter for their client.

events.title: Indictment Period for U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The time period covered by the indictment in the criminal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell. Blackfords proposes limiting questions to their client to this period.

locations: Hill House, 1 Mint Walk, Croydon, CR0 1EA
keyFacts: An unnamed client of Blackfords LLP is willing to provide a witness statement regarding his association with and knowledge of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The U.S. prosecutors view this client as a 'subject' of the investigation, not merely a witness, which raises concerns for his lawyers.
The lawyers propose a compromise: the client will provide a written witness statement and written answers to follow-up questions, but will not submit to an interview.
The lawyers insist the scope of questioning be limited to the indictment period in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is 1994-1997.
The lawyers demand strict confidentiality assurances that the client's information will only be used for the Maxwell criminal prosecution and not shared with complainants or in civil matters.
